intro: Blumella diantha, commonly known as the white blumella, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, white, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swampy areas. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth, glossy surface. Blumella diantha is often found in association with other moisture-loving plants in its natural habitat.
